subject: Re: [junit] TestNG 4 and Data Providers
msgSnippet: ... I exchanged a few emails with JB about that, and my take on data names is basically: I don t see the need. If a test method being fed by a data provider
messageBody:
On 10/12/05, Eugene Kuleshov <eu@...> wrote:
>
>
> Quite interesting that neither TestNG and JUnit4 does not take into
> account IDE or reporting needs.
>
> It is quite obvious that array-based parameter generator will not
> scale to large test suites. So, framework should provide some way to
> supply test data lazily.
>
> From other hand if you think of IDE it should be possible to run
> just specific test or only selected test cases. o, it seems that there
> should be some random-acess API, which iteterator just does not provide.
>
> Also note that one would be interested to know how many test cases
> in the given data provider as well as a readable name for each test.


I exchanged a few emails with JB about that, and my take on "data names" is
basically: I don't see the need.

If a test method being fed by a data provider fails, it will clearly say
something like "Expected 42 but got 41". From that point, it's pretty easy
to trace which data from the data set caused this error and act on it.

Actually, I would probably not even care about that myself: I would rerun my
tests, put a breakpoint on any assertion thrown and let the IDE show me
exactly where and when the test fails. Whether this test method was fed data
from a DataProvider or from somewhere else is irrelevant to fix the test.

PS: Cedric, I thouight we already discussed above points. Did you
> forgot that or my arguments wasn't very covincing?


Not at all, Eugene. In my response to Elliotte, I mentioned that he wasn't
the first one to make this request and I obviously had you in mind :-)

After thinking about it more, it might actually be completely trivial for
TestNG to support lazy data providers. I'll take a stab at it and I'll
report here with the results.


--
Cédric


[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]
